PlaySessionsRow.description: The trio-alif (ا - أ - إ): Same shape, different location of alif, absence & different location of hamza (ء), in different position in the word (just prononciation)
The trio jiim, haa, khaa (ج - ح – خ): Same shape, different location of a dot
The duo daal and dhaal (د – ذ): Same shape, absence of a dot
The duo raa and zaay (ر – ز): Same shape, absence of a dot
The duo siin and shiin (س – ش): Same shape, absence of three dots
The Saad and Daad (ص – ض): Same shape, absence of a dot
The Taa and DHaa (ط – ظ): Same shape, absence of a dot
The duo ayn and ghayn (ع – غ): Same shape, absence of a dot
The duo faa and qaaf (ف – ق): Same shape, different number of dots
The duo kaaf and laam (ك – ل): Same shape, absence of hamza (ء)
The duo miim and nuun (م – ن): No specific criterion, just different letters
The trio haa waaw yaa (ه - و - ي): No specific criterion, jusy different letters
The two shapes of the letter “alif” (ا ـا)
The four shapes of the letter "baa" (ب   ـب   ـبـ  بـ)
The six shapes of the letter “taa” (ت ـت  ة  ـة  ـتـ  تـ)
PlaySessionsRow.new_words: fig (تين)                       copybook (دفتر)                oil (زيت)                         whale (حوت)                second (ثانية)            woman (مرأة)

The sound of Fathah (َ) as a short vowel, Fatha on letters, and vocabulary,
PlaySessionsRow.old_words: طَ  rain (مطَر)         عَ   juice (عَصير)         كَ   laughed (ضَحِكَ)        صَ   glue (صَمغ)                تَ  copybook (دفتَر)

PlaySessionsRow.description: The diacritic sign “shadda” (ّ) as a double consonant

sun consonants: ت - ث - د - ذ - ر - ز - س - ش - ص - ض - ط - ظ - ل - ن
